Fields.DialogueText: Moskva, why are you standing in my way?
That's it? That's all you have to say?
That's what? What's with you?
I'm waiting, Kapitan!

Fields.MenuText: Can you please move out of my way?
You're scaring me, Moskva.
Waiting for what?! I'm waiting for you to get out of my way!

Fields.DialogueText: Really?! Nothing else?!
It's a simple matter of courtesy, Kapitan.
Not until you hurry it up!
You're not even going to say good morning?!
We're in the middle of a war.
And? What of it?
Forget about idle pleasantries, Moskva. There's work to be done.
Good morning to you too, Kapitan.
What's with her?
@BATTLE
Captain, more Morganas have been spotted.
Prepare for battle.
@BATTLE
Over here, Kapitan! Share a drink over our last victory!
Be right there!
(Moskva seems happy to see me...)
You know... there's something we've never discussed, Kapitan.
What might that be?
Your preferences.
Preferences?
What do you look for in a partner?

Fields.MenuText: Someone like me.
I want someone who complements my weaknesses.
What about you, Moskva?

Fields.DialogueText: Would you say we're similar, Kapitan?
I feel the same way. Synergy is important in a relationship.
I'm asking the questions, Kapitan.
Is everything okay, Moskva? Are you—
I'm trying to have a conversation with you, nothing more!
All right...
Kapitan, may I have a word?
Of course, Moskva. Let's grab something to eat and--
May we eat in your quarters? I don't want anyone eavesdropping.
Certainly. I'll meet you there.
I hope she's okay.
*ALARM*
Guess we'll have to meet up later.
@BATTLE
What did you want to talk about?
Well... it's about the war. I kind of... I don't want it to end.

Fields.MenuText: What? Are you crazy?! Why not?
You're going to miss the crew that much?!
Did you bang your head in that last battle?

Fields.DialogueText: I've become... acclimated to my surroundings, I suppose.
Something along those lines. It's hard to move on from something like this, you know?
No, but your attitude makes me wish I had!
Admit it, Moskva. You'll miss your favorite captain!
Oh hush.
Captain, Morgana sighting. What are your orders? Do we pursue?
@BATTLE
Moskva, what is that?
What's what?
Since when have you had a tattoo?
My, my, Kapitan, aren't you the blind one. Or do you suddenly find my beauty distracting?
Don't flatter yourself. Anyway, I can't read it. What does it say?
"Proletarier aller Länder vereinigt Euch!"
Ah. "Workers of the world, unite!"

Fields.MenuText: It shows serious dedication to get it tattooed on your body...
You believe in the Soviets that much?
Think you'll regret it one day?

Fields.DialogueText: My love for my homeland knows no bounds, Kapitan.
Of course I do! What kind of foolish question is that?!
Never. Their ideology will guide me until the day I'm nothing more than a pile of scrap.
Maybe you should get one as well.
I think I'll pass.
I've been meaning to ask about your locket, Moskva.
Curious, aren't we? What about it?
It's just... sometimes I see you look at it in battle. What's in it?
A photo, obviously.
May I see?
Be my guest.
A portrait of Joseph Stalin? Do you know him personally?
Unfortunately I have not had the honor. However, I admire him greatly.

Fields.MenuText: Am I another of your “idols"?
I'm better than him!
You admire him quite a lot, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: You wish, Kapitan. Though I admit you are rather good at what you do.
Not funny, Kapitan.
Do I detect a note of jealousy? Afraid he'll steal me away? How adorable.
My locket is getting a bit old, come to think of it.
(Maybe I could get her a new one...)
@BATTLE
First a locket, now a bracelet? It looks... religious in nature. I didn't know you were a Belle of faith, Moskva.
It's a token of Saint Basil.
Who?
A true saint. A friend to the common folk who took a firm stance against abuses of power.
Sounds a bit like you.
His legacy resonates with me. It reminds me of what my homeland is going through right now.
You mean with the Morganas?
No, in the war beforehand.

Fields.MenuText: You sure you're not religious?
I'll do some research on him. He sounds inspiring.
You really think the Soviets are comparable to a saint?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe a little. But I'm no fanatic.
You might learn something! Maybe I could teach you a few things as well.
Of course! To his message, his ideology!
We will have to table this discussion. I see a line of ships in the distance.
@BATTLE
Where is it?!
I don't know. Why would I keep track of it?!
You hate him! You'd do anything to kill his message!
Look, take it up with the captain! I've got to go!
Did someone say "captain"? What's going on?
My locket is missing! One of the crew must have taken it!

Fields.MenuText: Before you start blaming people, are you sure you didn't lose it?
I'll help you look for it.
You think the crew would really do such a thing?

Fields.DialogueText: I would never lose it!
Thank you, Kapitan. Let's search the ship in a grid.
I wouldn't put it past them! Especially the Americans!
*ALARM*
We'll find it later. First—
The Morganas take priority.
@BATTLE
*SHATTER*
Noooo! Well... I found the locket...
Was the shattering...?
Yes. Next time we resupply, I'll have to get it repaired.
I can get you another one, Moskva.
Nonsense. Don't trouble yourself.

Fields.MenuText: It obviously meant a great deal to you.
I wish I could do more to help.
You'll get over it.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, it did.
There's nothing you could've done, Kapitan.
Was that meant as encouragement?
You know, I haven't really asked if you could get in trouble for your attachment to a religious symbol.
There's certainly an argument for not calling attention to it.
But, regardless, right now we have other things to concern ourselves with.
Of course we do.
@BATTLE
Morganas approach, Captain, and we seem to be losing speed.
@BATTLE
Drinking?
How could you tell? All the booze on the table?! Very observant!
Is that vodka? Where'd you get your hands on that? We don't stock it.
I hide a flask in my leg holster.

Fields.MenuText: I've never seen a Belle so distraught over such a small object.
Stop being a baby, Moskva.
May I have a swig?

Fields.DialogueText: Fool! You don't understand. It was my charm!
Not another word. Unless you want to go for a swim in the ocean.
Sure.
Should I say a few words about your locket?
If you're not going to drink, at least be quiet.
*ALARM*
I shouldn't bother fixing this old thing.
What makes you say that?
The photo is gone!
The one of Stalin? What happened to it?
I'm telling you, the American crew took it! So what's the point?!

Fields.MenuText: I can get you another photo, Moskva.
I'm sure you can get another photo of Stalin.
I've never seen you like this before, Moskva. I'm worried about you.

Fields.DialogueText: It wouldn't be the same...
But that one was mine! I'd had it with me for so long!
You'd be like this too if you lost something you loved!
Can you try to hold it together in the meantime?
If you think this will affect my  fighting, you're mistaken.
That is good to hear, Moskva.
@BATTLE
Got a minute, Officer?
How can I assist, Capitan?
It's about Moskva—
She still crying over that locket? She needs to toughen up.

Fields.MenuText: And you need to respect our Belle. Either way, I need you to do something for me.
Speaking of which, I need a favor.
Since that's your attitude, you just volunteered to help me.

Fields.DialogueText: I was just kidding. What's the issue, Captain?
You're still on about it too?
Oh boy...
I need you to find a new locket for Moskva. Something elegant.
When we resupply, I'll ask around and see what I can dig up. In the meantime, we should deal with the current threat.
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Great work out there, Moskva! Graceful as always!
I suppose...
Are you okay?
Just tired. Find me if any other Morganas show up.
She's downcast. I guess that locket meant a lot to her.
Any word on a replacement for her?
Nothing. I was thinking you could contact the other Belles. They may have something for you...

Fields.MenuText: Where would I start? Ask one of her sisters?
I can try contacting the other Soviet Belles...

Fields.DialogueText: That's not a bad idea. It's worth a shot at least.
That's better than what I was thinking. You're really going out of your way for her.
I'll try to reach them.
What do you think, Moskva? Is this the day we finally get a shot in before they start trying to talk to us?
Nyet. Incoming transmission.
Dammit.
Where should I start?
With what?
The letter! We have to write to the other Belles about a new locket.
Why're you so hung up on this? Moskva will forget about that damn locket eventually. Why bother?

Fields.MenuText: Because this'll make her happy. A happy Belle can only help us.
None of your business.
Does it bother you?

Fields.DialogueText: Are you sure that's the reason?
You're awfully defensive about this, Captain.
I'm concerned that our captain has something on his mind other than the Morganas.
What are you trying to say?
I just don't want you to forget that we're fighting a war, Captain.
Speak of the devil...
@BATTLE
I haven't heard back from any of the Belles. How hard is it to find a decent locket?
You gave it your best shot, Captain. I think it's time to call it quits.

Fields.MenuText: No, I have to do this.
Maybe you're right...
Has Moskva gotten over it yet?

Fields.DialogueText: You're too stubborn... You're aware of that, right?
Glad you're starting to see things my way.
She still seems a bit depressed.
I have one more lead to follow.
Really? Please enlighten me.
We're headed towards a port that's supposedly bustling with all sorts of exotic items. We'll make a stop there if we get a chance.
I hate to stall our efforts against the Morganas—
You're doing this for her. I get it. May I offer some advice?
I'm listening.
Take a closer look at why you are doing this?
@BATTLE
Captain, there's a small group of ships ahead.
@BATTLE
Approaching the port, Captain.
Looks like the Morganas got here first.
(So much for that idea.)
Look, a few survivors! The whole place has been set ablaze!
Let's move in!
Multiple Morganas are still in the area!
If we push them back, we can get some supplies to this city. Looks like they need it!

Fields.MenuText: Focus on extracting civilians first!
Charge straight for the Morganas!
It's your call, Moskva.

Fields.DialogueText: Will do!
That lacks my usual grace, but it'll do.
Let's use the fire as a smokescreen!
*ALARM*
They left some ships behind for an ambush, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Looks like we defended the port. Did you get any information from the survivors?
The Morganas raided them, took the supplies meant for us, and planned to set up an outpost.
Not only that, but this area has been quite the hotspot lately. More of our allies have been stopping here to resupply.
And the Morganas caught wind of it, I'm guessing?
Yes, Kapitan. They were looking to cripple us, and they succeeded. There's not much left here.
They torched the supplies?
One Morgana unit got away with some. It wasn't anything useful though. Just jewelry.

Fields.MenuText: We need to track them down. Now.
I need a description of the Morgana vessel that took the jewelry.
Shall we go hunting?

Fields.DialogueText: Feeling bloodthirsty? I can't turn down a hunt, can I?
It was a small one... so small that it slipped by us at that last encounter.
There's fire in your eyes now!
The survivors may have seen which way they went. I'll ask around.
*ALARM*
Right there! I see the Morgana!
The ship certainly is... tiny. But she's got friends.
Let's hurry and blast them out of the water!
What about the jewelry?
Who cares? We don't need that stuff! Let's take it down right now!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we should use a little more caution.
What if I want some jewelry?
You're right.

Fields.DialogueText: What's your hangup?
You're hiding something from me. Is everything okay, Kapitan?
Of course, I'm right!
I'm okay, Moskva. I just—
Let's blow them out of the ocean!
Proceed.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, it appears we've made several direct hits, but they haven't given up yet!
@BATTLE
What about the jewelry! What's out there?!
Must you be so materialistic?!
It's not like that!
Well... it's all floating in the ocean right—
(No time to waste.)
Kapitan?!
(This is so stupid. This is so stupid. Why am I doing this for her?)
Where the hell are you sprinting to?!
(I'm an idiot. Well, here goes nothing...)
*SPLASH*
All enemies down!
(So cold... Did I make it?)
I can't believe this is our kapitan.
Moskva, you're to keep quiet about this foolish display. Tell the crew that the captain's eaten some bad fish and is sleeping it off, understood?
Forgive me, Captain, but what the hell was that?
That was—
The most idiotic thing a captain could do?
It was pretty foolish—
When I went after you, I grabbed the damn locket you swam after. You didn't make it very far.

Fields.MenuText: Did anyone see this?
I have a feeling I'm about to be stripped of my rank.
At least I got what I wanted!

Fields.DialogueText: Only Moskva and myself.
I'll keep this as quiet as I can.
To look like an idiot!?
Morganas in sight! We need our captain!
I'll meet you at the bridge. Don't draw attention to yourself.
@BATTLE
Now that I have a locket, I just need a photo.
Good Lord, you are slow! You haven't given her the locket yet? What's taking so long?!
I have to find her a replacement photo. I don't know how to do it.
What kind of photo?
A portrait of Stalin.
Put a photo of yourself in there.

Fields.MenuText: Not a bad idea.
I don't have a photo of myself.
Think she would like that?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a great idea. It can be a souvenir from the war.
So that's it, game over?
It's something. You need to act on this. Fast.
You're right.
*ALARM*
Wonderfully timed, as usual.
@BATTLE
Where have you been, Kapitan?!
What? We were fighting off the Morganas not too long ago.
I'm mean in your spare time. Usually we're together...

Fields.MenuText: Is that your way of saying you miss me, Moskva?
I'm on your mind then?
I've been busy with other things.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm worried you'll get yourself into trouble!
Well, you are the kapitan.
Stop being busy and start spending time with me! It's your job to keep morale high!
If you'd like, we could grab something to eat right now. I'm not doing much—
*ALARM*
We can eat after this...
Sounds like a plan.
@BATTLE
What do you think your life will be like after the war, Kapitan?
That's a tough question.
Think we'll get out of this alive?
Of course. I just find it bizarre that one day the war will be over, and life will go back to normal.
You still haven't answered my question.

Fields.MenuText: Hopefully I'll settle down with someone special.
Honestly, I have no idea, Moskva.
I'm not going to go too far away from life on the sea, if that's what you're worried about.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh really? Do you have someone in mind?
That doesn't sound like you.
You'd better not! You can't escape me now!
Seriously, it's a hard question to answer.
A lot of it depends on what you Belles can do when the shooting stops. I don't know how I'd feel about living inland if some of my favorite people in the world were always going to be out here.
Set aside what you can control. What do you *want*?
*ALARM*
Never mind. I think I can guess.
@BATTLE
Here you go. Special delivery while Moskva's overseeing repairs.
What is this?
A photo of you and Moskva.
Looks like we're both pointing... Did you take this during a battle?
Promise you won't get mad?
You took it during battle, didn't you?
It's possible.

Fields.MenuText: It is a pretty good photo.
I hope Moskva will like it.
Thank you for this.

Fields.DialogueText: I think Moskva will like it, Captain.
I'm sure she will.
My pleasure, Kapitan.
I'm off. Thank you again!
Everyone, get to action positions! And if Moskva's not on the bridge, tell her to get there immediately!
@BATTLE
Moskva, when we are done with this last Morgana, the Captain wants a word with you.
@BATTLE
Kap—What's this?
Well, you were awfully discouraged about losing your locket—
You got me a new one?! May I... May I see it?
Knock yourself out.
Oh my goodness... And the photo...

Fields.MenuText: I hope this makes up for the loss of your other locket, Moskva.
After the war... I wanted you to have a reminder of our time together and how it wasn't all bad.
You mean you like it?

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitan...
This is so thoughtful!
I love it!
This means so much to me, Kapitan. Thank you!
I'm glad to see you happy.
Kapitan...
Kapitan.
What's going on, Moskva? Usually you're resting by now.
I was thinking about what you said earlier...
Yes?
Even without the locket, I could never forget our time together.
Same here.
May I stay here with you awhile longer?
I'd love that.
